noun.description: Each of a series of slender curved bones articulated in pairs to the spine (twelve pairs in humans), protecting the thoracic cavity and its organs.
A long raised piece of stronger or thicker material across a surface or through a structure, and typically serving to support or strengthen it.
A vein of a leaf (especially the midrib) or an insect's wing.
A combination of alternate knit (plain) and purl stitches producing a ridged, slightly elastic fabric, used especially for the cuffs and bottom edges of sweaters.

verb.description: Mark with or form into raised bands or ridges.
examples: the road ahead was ribbed with furrows of slush
the first time I appeared in the outfit I was ribbed mercilessly
